channel.title: Sam Spade Podcast
channel.itunes:author: OTR
channel.itunes:summary: Sam Spade was a detective radio program and an almost literal transition from Dashiell Hammett's 1930 crime classic, The Maltese Falcon.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Sam Spade, the famous detective radio program from the Golden Days of Radio.

item.title: Sam Shovel - Case Of A Boy Named Tony
item.description: Abbott & Costello spoof of Sam Spade. 10.28.1948
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: Abbott & Costello spoof of Sam Spade. 10.28.1948

item.title: The Critical Author Case
item.description: Spade is hired to find Gabrielle Leggitt, who has disappeared. The author of murder mysteries plays an important part in the case. William Spier (producer, director), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Rene Garriguenc (composer), Dick Joy (announcer), Lud Gluskin (music director), Dashiell Hammett (creator), Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle. August 15, 1948. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: Spade is hired to find Gabrielle Leggitt, who has disappeared. The author of murder mysteries plays an important part in the case. William Spier (producer, director), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Rene Garriguenc (composer), Dick Joy (announcer), Lud Gluskin (music director), Dashiell Hammett (creator), Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle. August 15, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Bluebeard Caper
item.description: Ned Towers needs help with his sister. She's about to marry Jefferson Davis Calhoun, who's been married and widowed three times. Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Lud Gluskin (music director), Dick Joy (announcer). August 8, 1948. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR

Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Lud Gluskin (music director), Dick Joy (announcer). August 8, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Dry Martini Caper
item.description: A wealthy businessman is shot in broad daylight. Spade tracks down the killer. Howard Duff. August 1, 1948. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: A wealthy businessman is shot in broad daylight. Spade tracks down the killer. Howard Duff. August 1, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Mad Scientist Caper
item.description: Raymond Fox is a famous but slightly insane inventor. He hires Spade to recover the secret formula for "Pentron." Sam promptly winds up in a hospital for the mentally deranged! Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer), Dick Joy (announcer), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer, director), Lud Gluskin (music director). July 25, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Missing Newshawk Caper
item.description: Spade is hired to find a reporter named Ray McCully. Spade finds him all right, stabbed to death! Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Conrad, Sara Berner, Bea Benaderet (possibly), Alan Reed, Gil Doud (writer, director), Robert Tallman (writer), Lud Gluskin (music), Dick Joy (announcer). July 18, 1948. CBS.

July 18, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Maltese Falcon
item.description: British Broadcasting Company production of the classic 1930 Dashiel Hammet novel. Podshow PDN {podshow-9a35f1a383be4fb85d861ec1caba21c9}
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: British Broadcasting Company production of the classic 1930 Dashiel Hammet novel. Podshow PDN {podshow-9a35f1a383be4fb85d861ec1caba21c9}

item.title: The Wheel Of Life Caper
item.description: Sam meets a mystery woman with no memory and a corpse that's been killed by a buzz saw! Sara Berner (Sandra Gould?) replaces Lurene Tuttle as Effie, Sam's secretary. Howard Duff, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Sara Berner, Gil Doud (writer), Robert Tallman (writer), Lud Gluskin (music director), Dick Joy (announcer). July 11, 1948. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: Sam meets a mystery woman with no memory and a corpse that's been killed by a buzz saw! Sara Berner (Sandra Gould?) replaces Lurene Tuttle as Effie, Sam's secretary. Howard Duff, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Sara Berner, Gil Doud (writer), Robert Tallman (writer), Lud Gluskin (music director), Dick Joy (announcer). July 11, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Rushlight Diamond Caper
item.description: July 4, 1948. CBS net. Sponsored by: Wildroot Cream Oil. Sam is hired to guard the wedding presents, but not the groom, who is stabbed to death with a pair of garden shears! Sara Berner (Sandra Gould?) replaces Lurene Tuttle as Effie, Sam's secretary. Howard Duff, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer), Sara Berner, Dick Joy (announcer), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer, director), Lud Gluskin (music director). 1/2 Hour.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: July 4, 1948. CBS net. Sponsored by: Wildroot Cream Oil. Sam is hired to guard the wedding presents, but not the groom, who is stabbed to death with a pair of garden shears! Sara Berner (Sandra Gould?) replaces Lurene Tuttle as Effie, Sam's secretary. Howard Duff, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer), Sara Berner, Dick Joy (announcer), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer, director), Lud Gluskin (music director). 1/2 Hour.

item.title: The Bail Bond Caper
item.description: A million dollar robbery from an armored car puts Sam on the spot and in need of some bail himself! Sara Berner (Sandra Gould?) replaces Lurene Tuttle as Effie, Sam's secretary. Howard Duff, Sara Berner, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Conrad, Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer, director), Lud Gluskin (music), Dick Joy (announcer). June 27, 1948. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR

Howard Duff, Sara Berner, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Conrad, Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer, director), Lud Gluskin (music), Dick Joy (announcer). June 27, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Deathbed Caper
item.description: Dan Starbuck hires Spade to witness a deathbed statement by his brother Gordon. His brother however accuses him of murder! This program has also been referred to as, "The Caper With two Death Beds." Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Cathy Lewis, William Conrad (doubles), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Lud Gluskin (music), Dick Joy (announcer), Berne Surrey (sound effects), Elliott Lewis, Wally Maher (doubles). 1June 20, 1948. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: Dan Starbuck hires Spade to witness a deathbed statement by his brother Gordon. His brother however accuses him of murder! This program has also been referred to as, "The Caper With two Death Beds." Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Cathy Lewis, William Conrad (doubles), Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Lud Gluskin (music), Dick Joy (announcer), Berne Surrey (sound effects), Elliott Lewis, Wally Maher (doubles). 1June 20, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Gold Key Caper
item.description: Murder, mayhem, machine guns, Malloy and a half million The cast credits and the system cue have been deleted. Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator). 1/2 Hour.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: Murder, mayhem, machine guns, Malloy and a half million The cast credits and the system cue have been deleted. Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dashiell Hammett (creator). 1/2 Hour.

item.title: The One Hour Caper
item.description: A hit and run murder leads to a Dutch cigarette case and a bullet with Sam's name on it. The program closing and system cue have been deleted. Howard Duff, Irene Duff. January 4, 1948. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: A hit and run murder leads to a Dutch cigarette case and a bullet with Sam's name on it. The program closing and system cue have been deleted. Howard Duff, Irene Duff. January 4, 1948. CBS.

item.title: The Bow-Window Caper
item.description: A woman with only one month to live is found murdered. Howard Duff. November 9, 1947. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: A woman with only one month to live is found murdered. Howard Duff. November 9, 1947. CBS.

item.title: The Adam Figg Caper
item.description: Sam is hired to protect a old, sick, very wealthy man. There are lots of gunshots and screams in the night. Howard Duff cracks up when an "office robot" given to him by Effie, fails to work. Howard Duff, William Spier (producer, director), Dashiell Hammett (creator), Lurene Tuttle, Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Dick Joy (announcer), Lud Gluskin (music director).
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: Sam is hired to protect a old, sick, very wealthy man. There are lots of gunshots and screams in the night. Howard Duff cracks up when an "office robot" given to him by Effie, fails to work. Howard Duff, William Spier (producer, director), Dashiell Hammett (creator), Lurene Tuttle, Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Dick Joy (announcer), Lud Gluskin (music director).

item.title: The Convertible Caper
item.description: June 15, 1947. CBS net origination, AFRS rebroadcast. A stolen car is worth one million dollars. Why? Could it be the platinum fenders? The program closing and system cue have been deleted. Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Elliott Lewis (director), Lud Gluskin (music director). 1/2 Hour.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: June 15, 1947. CBS net origination, AFRS rebroadcast. A stolen car is worth one million dollars. Why? Could it be the platinum fenders? The program closing and system cue have been deleted. Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Robert Tallman (writer), Gil Doud (writer), Elliott Lewis (director), Lud Gluskin (music director). 1/2 Hour.

item.title: Sam and Psyche
item.description: A psychiatrist being blackmailed is killed by doing "a Brody" from his apartment window. His blackmailer is later found strangled! Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dick Joy (announcer), Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Fred Esler. August 2, 1946. ABC.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: A psychiatrist being blackmailed is killed by doing "a Brody" from his apartment window. His blackmailer is later found strangled! Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle, Dick Joy (announcer), Dashiell Hammett (creator), William Spier (producer, director), Fred Esler. August 2, 1946. ABC.

item.title: The Calcutta Trunk Caper
item.description: Constance Pendleton is about to marry Andreyev Brodnick, a Bulgarian bluebeard. Spade finds himself enroute to India aboard the "S. S. Lurene" ("A nice name," says Effie!). Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle. 1/2 Hour. June 8, 1947. CBS.
item.itunes:author: OTR
item.itunes:summary: Constance Pendleton is about to marry Andreyev Brodnick, a Bulgarian bluebeard. Spade finds himself enroute to India aboard the "S. S. Lurene" ("A nice name," says Effie!). Howard Duff, Lurene Tuttle. 1/2 Hour. June 8, 1947. CBS.
